DataElement.preferredDefinition: The total percentage of plasma cells in the sample submitted.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to plasma cells in a bone marrow biopsy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The soft tissue filling the cavities of bones. Bone marrow exists in two types, yellow and red. Yellow marrow is found in the large cavities of large bones and consists mostly of fat cells and a few primitive blood cells. Red marrow is a hematopoietic tissue and is the site of production of erythrocytes and granular leukocytes. Bone marrow is made up of a framework of connective tissue containing branching fibers with the frame being filled with marrow cells (MSH98):Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Specialized forms of antibody-producing B-LYMPHOCYTES. They synthesize and secrete immunoglobulin. They are found only in lymphoid organs and at sites of immune responses and normally do not circulate in the blood or lymph. (Rosen et al., Dictionary of Immunology, 1989, p169 & Abbas et al., Cellular and Molecular Immunology, 2d ed, p20)

Concepts.definition: A fully mature B-Cell that produces a specific antibody.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Percentage value for a cell count with 5 max, 3 min and 2 decimal places.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for Myeloma project sponsored by the American Society of Hematology. mc 3/9/17
